qas.question: Comparing a heavy and a lightweight piece of wood from a pine, which would have a greater proportion of latewood?
What feature of a piece of pine with more latewood would be more clear and pronounced?
What type of tree has very little contrast between parts of its growth rings?
Is white pine easy or difficult to work with because of its texture?
What kind of pines have very deep, darkly colored hardwood that stands out against the light earlywood?

context: If a <a0_0>heavy<a0_0/> piece of pine is compared with a lightweight piece it will be seen at once that the heavier one contains a larger proportion of latewood than the other, and is therefore showing more clearly demarcated <a1_0>growth rings<a1_0/>. In <a2_0>white pines<a2_0/> there is not much contrast between the different parts of the ring, and as a result the wood is very uniform in texture and is <a3_0>easy<a3_0/> to work. In <a4_0>hard pines<a4_0/>, on the other hand, the latewood is very dense and is deep-colored, presenting a very decided contrast to the soft, straw-colored earlywood.
